question: 嫌味な
sourceAnswer: Hurtful Words, Hurtful Speech, Sarcasm, Disagreeableness
sourceMnemonic: You have a <kanji>flavor</kanji> of <kanji>dislike</kanji>. If someone gives you "flavor" and you dislike it, what might that "flavor" be? How about <vocabulary>hurtful words</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading for <ja>味</ja> is the on'yomi you learned with the kanji, but the reading for <ja>嫌</ja> is the kun'yomi, <ja>いや</ja>. Just imagine someone saying words so hurtful that you have to scream, "<reading>Iya</reading>aaaa!" <ja>いや</ja>.
